channel.title: Updating the forum
channel.description:
The forum has gotten just a little outdated. SMF 1.1.5 came out not too long ago, and SMF 2.0 Beta also came out a while back. I'm guessing there are Modifications installed that might make upgrading harder, but updating to 1.1.5 isn't rocket science. Also, 2.0 has some great administration features that would really prove useful to the Moderators, and I'm hoping the banning system has been improved. I think 1.1.5 would do for now though, and 2.0 should wait until it is no longer in Beta form. I recommend trying 2.0 Beta for yourself, it has worked well for me. (So far :P)
But since this is a highly loaded forum, keeping updated is a good idea. Also, the RuneScape © 1999-2006, Jagex Ltd. at the bottom should probably be changed to 1999-2008.

item.title: Updating the forum
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

1.1.5 fixes some bugs and covers up some exploits etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Updating the forum
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

I don’t see a point in updating it to 1.1.5, as there really are no new features. The only possible upgrade I would probably agree on would be when 2.0 is out of the beta stages.

Read full topic

item.title: Updating the forum
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

I do not see the point in going from 1.1.4 -> 1.1.5. Sure, 1.1.4 -> 2.0, but 1.1.5 has no apparent new things added.
They’re all minor changes and not a lot of stuff added. (Changelog: http://simplemachines.org/download/index.php/smf_1-1-5_changelog.txt )

For the time mopar would need to fix anything that would happen in upgrading with the current mods he has on, it would probably mean more downtime than the current idiots on here can take before they explode.
(But I guess he could do a full install (not upgrading) on a different folder, then add the mods and stuff, test it, and then move those files to the folder this smf install is in.)

Read full topic
